column4: howdy folks,  I am trying to install wordpress on my ubuntu server.  so i figured i would do so the ubuntu blessed way and use apt-get.  after ward I tried to run the setup-mysql script and got an error.  "Access denied for user 'root@localhost'@'localhost'"
What did you run for running that mysql script?
I made a soft link in /var/www to /usr/share/blahblah
why would it use the user root@localhost@localhost instead of jsut root@localhost or just root
So what would be the actual command you run in order to run the script?
Sorry to ask again. Does anyone have the battery monitor showing the time remaining in your ubuntu 9.10?
did you try to run "bash /usr/share/doc/wordpress/examples/setup-mysql -n name --user=user --password fqdn"
or something like that were you specify the user and that it should ask for password
by the way. Are you running ubuntu on a laptop?
anyone here running ubuntu 9.10 on a laptop?
ok, seems noone has a laptop on ubuntu here...
don't seem to be able to pass mysql opts to this script like that. or atleast not in that order.
those options work at least for the mysql command try to run "man setup-mysql" to see the options then
or maybe that script does not have man pages...
